body:
### Problem

When inspect a piece of code that has nested injections, `:InspectTree` overrides the first node with the last, and also never tries to handle child's injections

This piece of code below for a file named `test.html` is an example, while using with nvim-treesitter, 
```html
<html>
<body>
<script>
const x = html`<foo></foo>`
</script>
</body>
</html>
```

### Steps to reproduce

- repro.lua
```lua
for name, url in pairs{
  nvim_treesitter = 'https://github.com/nvim-treesitter/nvim-treesitter'
} do
  local install_path = vim.fn.fnamemodify('nvim_issue/'..name, ':p')
  if vim.fn.isdirectory(install_path) == 0 then
    vim.fn.system { 'git', 'clone', '--depth=1', url, install_path }
  end
  vim.opt.runtimepath:append(install_path)
end

require("nvim-treesitter.configs").setup({
  ensure_installed = { "html", "javascript" },
})
```

- `nvim -u repro.lua test.html`
- `:InspectTree`



### Expected behavior

It should correctly handle nested injections

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

0.10.0-dev commit 86c2213b5e451b0c80c2d7adc356c7cebe4bb7f8

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

N/A

### Operating system/version

Linux 6.6.1

### Terminal name/version

kitty 0.31.0

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-kitty

### Installation

Build from source
title: `:InspectTree` incorrectly handles nested injections
